docs.snippet: With the men’s team looking listless, the wheels of change are turning in Brazil’s macho society as fans express a respect for the women’s game, and chagrin that it took so long....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the men’s team looking listless, the wheels of change are turning in Brazil’s macho society as fans express a respect for the women’s game, and chagrin that it took so long.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column holds that Brazilian women's soccer players, whose outstanding skills are matched only by their artful joy of life, have captured hearts of all Olympic fans.

headline.main: In Brazil, Where Men’s Soccer Once Was King, the Women’s Game Rules

docs.abstract: John Saunders, sportscaster for ESPN and ABC who was known for his calm demeanor, dies at age 61.

docs.lead_paragraph: NBC has done better since the opening ceremony, when viewership fell 35 percent compared with four years ago.
docs.abstract: NBC reports viewership for 2016 Olympic Games fell by 35 percent for opening ceremony, and 28 percent in first day of competition, compared with 2012 Olympics.

headline.main: As Olympic Viewership Falls, NBC Thinks of the Bigger Picture
